question.title: jdk-25, main is never used
question.body:
I am using jdk-25 with VSCode, and Maven for Workspace, and I want to use the new syntax but I can not get rid of the error code: "main is never used"

My HelloWorld code is:


package org.rwth.progra;

public class Vs_code {

    void main() {
        IO.println("Hello World!");
    }
}

It outputs as I expected, because it is too new and it has to enable preview mode, and that is the reason why I use --enable-preview while running, but the error is still there.

The terminal line is:

& 'C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-25\bin\java.exe' '--enable-preview' '-XX:+ShowCodeDetailsInExceptionMessages' '-cp' 'C:\Users\moenc\Desktop\Programme\vs_code\target\classes' 'org.rwth.progra.Vs_code' 
Hello World!

There is no problem with jdk-25, but the hint message main is never used is still there. I tried to solve it with AI more than 10 times, and each time it says, I have to find, if it is really using jdk-25, and it is. I changed the environment configuration to jdk-25 in 3 different ways.

The settings.json configuration:

"java.jdt.ls.java.home": "C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-25",

    "java.configuration.runtimes": [
        {
            "name": "JavaSE-25",
            "path": "C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-25",
            "default": true
        }

"java.debug.settings.vmArgs": "--enable-preview",

"maven.terminal.customEnv": [
        {
            "name": "JAVA_HOME",
            "value": "C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-25",
            "environmentVariable": "JAVA_HOME"
        }
    ],

"java.project.outputPath": "C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk-25"

But it is still there!

question_comments.body: @rzwitserloot in case of Eclipse, I only know of warnings about unused private members. So it doesn’t need an exemption for the main method, as the method can only serve as application entry if it is not private. Therefore, it also doesn’t need an update to consider Java 25’s ability to call a non-static main method. This method wouldn’t trigger a warning, even if it was not the main method.

@Holger it's obviously coming from VSCode, indeed. I'm not sure it's simply VSCode being out of date (also, these warnings would then come from eclipse as that's the langserver used, but this isn't by default something eclipse warns about, complicating the plot somewhat), and eclipse is 25 compatible (besides, this feature predates 25 by some margin; admittedly, preview until recently, but eclipse supports those just as well). Hence I'm guessing: The project is in release 21 or earlier mode.

You don’t need --enable-preview at all when using this feature with JDK-25. It’s officially released. Besides that, it’s not clear, where this “main is never used” messages comes from. Surely not from the Java compiler. This seems to be an audit that shipped with VSCode, which may be out of date.
Try removing the class definition. JDK 25 supports a top level main() method.

settings.json merely says which java executable to use. It does not say which version to use. You'd expect something like "java.jdt.release": 25 (Don't actually do that, I made it up, but it'd look something like that).
